```{r setup, include=FALSE}

library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)
library(fable)
library(tibbletime)
library(feasts)
library(tsibble)
library(sweep)
library(knitr)
library(fable.prophet)
library(pander)
library(fasster)

knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

load("pharmacy.rda")

h <- 42

site_c <- pharmacy %>% 
  filter(NSVCode == "Drug A") %>% 
  filter(Site1 == "Site C") %>%
  filter(Total_Qty >= 0) %>% 
  group_by(Date) %>%
  summarise(quantity = sum(Total_Qty, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% 
  ungroup() %>%  
  tsibble(index = Date) %>% 
  fill_gaps(quantity = 0)

```

## Summary of model

```{r}

train_c <- site_c %>% 
  head(-h)

# fit model

fit <- train_c %>%
  model(ETS(quantity))

# parameters

report(fit)

```

## Plot

```{r}

fit %>% 
  forecast(h = h) %>% 
  autoplot(site_c %>% head(-h) %>% tail(42))

```

## Plot components

```{r}

components(fit) %>%
  tail(100) %>% 
  autoplot()

```

## Forecast standard deviation

(see [https://otexts.com/fpp3/ets-forecasting.html](https://otexts.com/fpp3/ets-forecasting.html))

For an A, N, A model:

where $\sigma_{h}$ is the residual variance, m is the seasonal period, and k is the integer part of $\frac{hâˆ’1}{m}$ (i.e., the number of complete years in the forecast period prior to time T + h)

$$\sigma^2_{h} = \sigma^2(1 + \alpha^2(h -1) + \gamma k(2\alpha + \gamma))$$

```{r}

alpha_fit <- fit %>% 
  coef() %>% 
  filter(term == "alpha") %>% 
  pull(estimate)

gamma_fit <- fit %>% 
  coef() %>% 
  filter(term == "gamma") %>% 
  pull(estimate)

var_resid <- fit %>% 
  augment() %>% 
  as_tibble() %>% 
  summarise(sd_resid = var(.resid, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% 
  pull(sd_resid)

var_resid <- var_resid * (1 + (alpha_fit^2 * (h -1)) + 
                            gamma_fit * 6 * (2 * alpha_fit + gamma_fit))

```

Standard deviation of the forecast is `r var_resid ^ .5`.

## Produce actual levels of the forecast

```{r}

fit_forecast <- fit %>% 
  forecast(h = h) %>% 
  as_tibble() %>% 
  mutate(cumulative = cumsum(.mean)) %>% 
  select(Date, value = .mean, cumulative) 

save(fit_forecast, file = "ets_forecast.rda")

```
